message.content:
<<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>: try { 
    PrintWriter writer1 = new PrintWriter(new FileWriter("C:\\Users\\usersb\\Downloads\\rpms\\newrpms.txt", true));
    for(int i = 0 ; i < fileCon1.size() ; i++){                    
        writer1.println(fileCon1.get(i));
    }
    System.out.println("updated newrpms.txt");
    writer1.close();
} catch (IOException e) {
    e.printStackTrace();
}
<<<explanation>>>: The issue is that you are creating a new PrintWriter object each time you call the copyFile method, which overwrites the existing file. To append the strings to the file, you need to use the FileWriter constructor with the "append" parameter set to true. This will allow you to append the strings to the file instead of overwriting it.
